content: last chain and turn your work clockwise but do not flip it over continue along the other side working 1sc into the blo of each chain until you reach the last chain 2sc in last chain which is the same chain you made the 2sc at the start do not join you will continue straight onto round 2 26sts you will now work into both loops again as normal and continue to work in circles without joining between rnds rnds 2-14 hhdc in the first st from the previous round place a st marker in that st to mark the first st of this round hhdc in each st around do not join 26sts you will now start working on the opening edge and hanging loop for your sack option a pink sack round 15 hhdc in the first st from the previous round place a st marker in that st to mark the first st of this round hhdc in the next 4 sts chain 6 sts and skip 6 sts be careful not to twist the ch6 hhdc in the next 6 sts chain 6 sts and skip 6 sts be careful not to twist the ch6 hhdc in last st do not join 26sts round 16 hhdc in the first st from the previous round place a st marker in that st to mark the first st of this round hhdc in each st around including the chain sts at the handles when you reach the end of the round slip_stitch to first st to join fasten_off weave in loose ends the loopy soap sack is now finished option b sand sack round 15 single_crochet in first from the previous round place a st marker in that st to mark the first st of this round *make 1 puff st in the next st remember to ch1 to secure the st skip next st* repeat until end slip_stitch to first st to join ch10 to form a hanging loop slip_stitch into the same st where you made your ch10 fasten_off weave in loose ends the loopy soap sack is now finished pattern use this pattern is copyrighted to loopy handmade and may not be copied
